enWisdom: Modesty is the lowering of one’s gaze
The cornerstone of piety is lowering one’s gaze

Wisdom: غَضُّ الطَّرْفِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرِ النَّظَرِ
enWisdom: Lowering the gaze is better than staring
Lowering the gaze is a sign of magnanimity
Lowering the gaze is from perfect gracefulness
Lowering the gaze is one of the best [acts of] piety

Wisdom: غَضُّ الطَّرْفِ عَنْ مَحَارِمِ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَفْضَلُ عِبَادَةٍ
ذَهَابُ النَّظَرِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ النَّظَرِ إِلَى مَا يُوجِبُ الْفِتْنَةَ
enWisdom: Loss of vision is better than looking at something that causes temptation

Wisdom: مِنَ الْمُرُوءَةِ غَضُّ الطَّرْفِ وَمَشْيُ الْقَصْدِ
enWisdom: Lowering the gaze and walking with modesty are part of magnanimity
How good an act of piety lowering the gaze is!
There is no magnanimity like lowering the gaze
